table.name: mem
table.column: This is a shortened form of {Qu'vatlh:excl}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is used to say that something is unexpected or surprising or counterintuitive, not just additional. For that, one would use {je:adv}.[2]

▶ {Qo'noS romuluS je boSuqlaH. vabDot tera' Qejbogh DIvI' ram boSuqlaH.:sen:nolink} "Kronos, Romulus and even the puny Federation's precious Earth, are all up for grabs."[1] ▶ {vabDot Sovbe' targhwIj.:sen}

table.name: mem
table.column: Selbst mein Targ wird es nicht wissen.
حتی هدف من هم نمی داند [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Även min targ kommer inte att veta. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Até o meu targ não saberá.
This was the winning secrecy proverb entry, submitted by Jack Bradley ({DeSDu':n:name,nolink}), in the proverbs competition at {qep'a' 25 (2018):src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: There is an expression, {vaDjaj yaDDu'lIj:sen:nolink} "may your toes be flexible", the meaning of which is unclear, but which might be a wish for good fortune.

table.name: mem
table.column: fifth tone of nonatonic musical scale
تن پنجم از مقیاس موسیقی غیرتتونونی [AUTOTRANSLATED]
femte tonen på den nonatoniska skalan
fifth tone of nonatonic musical scale [AUTOTRANSLATED]
quinto tom de escala musical não-atônica
The tones of the Klingon musical scale (see {yutlhegh:n}) are: {yu:n}, {bIm:n}, {'egh:n}, {loS:n:2}, {vagh:n:2,nolink}, {jav:n:2}, {Soch:n:2}, {chorgh:n:2}, {yu:n:nolink}.

table.name: mem
mem
table.column: {vagh reD mey' HoS:n@@vagh reD mey':n, HoS:v} "regular pentagon"[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This can actually be used for anything that acts as a cover for something one puts inside of it.[3]

table.name: mem
table.column: so, then, thus, in that case
بنابراین، در این صورت، در این مورد [AUTOTRANSLATED]
så, därför, således, i så fall
Note that this is not a conjunction, but an adverbial.
Beachten Sie, dass dies keine Konjunktion ist, sondern ein Adverbial. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
توجه داشته باشید که این یک پیوستگی نیست ، بلکه یک قید و بند است. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Observera att detta inte är en konjunktion utan en adverbial. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Обратите внимание, что это не союз, а наречие. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
請注意，這不是連詞，而是狀語。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Observe que isso não é uma conjunção, mas um adverbial. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: This word refers to the concept of warriorhood (e.g., "warrior spirit", and so on). To refer to a person who is a warrior, use {SuvwI':n}.[2]
▶ {vaj toDuj Daj ngeHbej DI vI'.:sen} ▶ {vaj Duj chIj:sen:idiom}

table.name: mem
table.column: This idiomatic expression literally means "warrior ship" or "warrior instincts", due to the homophony between {Duj:n:1} and {Duj:n:2}.
▶ {vaj Duj DachIj.:sen:nolink} "You have strength of character."

table.name: mem
table.column: This idiomatic expression literally means "to navigate a warrior ship".
Dieser idiomatische Ausdruck bedeutet wörtlich "ein Kriegerschiff navigieren". [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این اصطلاح اصطلاحاً به معنای واقعی کلمه به معنای "حرکت در یک کشتی جنگجو" است. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta idiomatiska uttryck betyder bokstavligen "att navigera i ett krigsfartyg". [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это идиоматическое выражение буквально означает «управлять кораблем воина». [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這個慣用語的字面意思是“駕駛勇士船”。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Essa expressão idiomática significa literalmente "navegar em um navio guerreiro". [AUTOTRANSLATED]
▶ {vaj Duj DachIj.:sen:nolink} "You have strength of character."

table.name: mem
table.column: سپس شما آن را دیده اید. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: vaj toDuj Daj ngeHbej DI vI'.
Shooting space garbage is no test of a warrior's mettle.
Weltraumschrott abzuschießen ist kein Test für den Mut eines Kriegers.
زباله فضایی تیراندازی هیچ تست از یک جنگجو نیست. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Skyddsutrymme sopor är inget test av en krigareens mettle. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Стрельба из космического мусора не является испытанием силы воина. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
射擊太空垃圾不足以考驗戰士的勇氣。
Atirar no lixo espacial não é prova da coragem de um guerreiro.

This is a backfit for the sentence, {vaj toDDujDaj ngeHbej DIvI'.@@vaj:adv, toDDuj:n, -Daj:n, ngeH:v, -bej:v, DIvI':n} "That means the Federation will be sending a rescue ship of its own." Both sentences were spoken by Captain Klaa in {Star Trek V:src}.
The original line was to have been {logh veQDaq bachchugh, yoH 'e' toblaHbe' SuvwI'.@@logh:n, veQ:n, -Daq:n, bach:v, -chugh:v, yoH:v, 'e':n, tob:v, -laH:v, -be':v, SuvwI':n}

table.name: mem
table.column: vara klipsk, vara smart, vara intelligent

table.name: mem
table.column: The Chinese transliteration comes from the subtitles of {Star Trek III:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: The 2009 {Star Trek:src} movie has a deleted scene with the line: {tIjwI'ghom bovanrupbe'chugh, vaj reQaw'.:sen:nolink}

table.name: mem
table.column: end (an event, voyage, battle, play, opera, story, song, etc.)
beenden (eine Reise, Kampf, Spiel, Oper, Lied usw.)
پایان (رویداد، سفر، نبرد، بازی، اپرا، داستان، آهنگ، و غیره) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
avsluta (en händelse, t.ex. resa, strid, sång)
конец (событие, путешествие, битва, спектакль, опера, история, песня и т. д.) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
結束（事件，航程、戰鬥、遊戲、歌劇、故事、歌曲等） [AUTOTRANSLATED]
fim (um evento, viagem, batalha, peça, ópera, história, música etc.)

The subject of this verb is the person causing an event to end. The object is the event that is ended. If the event was prematurely brought to an end, use {ghang:v} instead. To describe the ending of a period of time, use {Dor:v:2} instead.

Das Subjekt dieses Verbes ist die Person, die ein Ereignis beendet. Das Objekt ist das Ereignis, welches beendet wird. Falls das Ereignis vorzeitig beendet wird, benutzt man {ghang:v} stattdessen. Um das Enden eines Zeitabschnitts zu beschreiben, verwendet man {Dor:v:2}.

table.name: mem
table.column: A planet in the Gamma Quadrant.
سیاره ای در چهار گوش گاما. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
伽瑪象限中的一顆行星。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: vangDI' tlhIngan SuvwI' ngoy' qorDu'Daj; vangDI' qorDu'Daj ngoy' tlhIngan SuvwI'.
The family of a Klingon warrior is responsible for his actions, and he is responsible for theirs.
Die Familie eines Klingonen ist verantwortlich für dessen Taten, und er ist verantwortlich für die Taten der Familie.
خانواده یک جنگجوی کلینگان مسئول اقداماتش است و مسئولیت آن را دارد. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Familjen av en Klingon krigare är ansvarig för sina handlingar, och han är ansvarig för deras. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
The family of a Klingon warrior is responsible for his actions, and he is responsible for theirs. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
克林崗戰士的家人對他的行為負責，他負責他們的行為。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
A família de um guerreiro klingon é responsável por suas ações, e ele é responsável pelas delas.

table.name: mem
table.column: ▶ {bI'reS qeylIS vaq molor:sen:nolink} "First, Molor taunts Kahless"[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a planet in the Klingon Empire in which native languages have survived alongside Klingon.
Dies ist ein Planet im klingonischen Reich, auf dem neben Klingonisch auch Muttersprachen überlebt haben. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این سیاره ای در امپراتوری کلینگون است که در آن زبان های بومی در کنار کلینگون زنده مانده اند. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta är en planet i Klingon Empire där infödda språk har överlevt tillsammans med Klingon. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это планета в империи клингонов, в которой наряду с клингонами сохранились родные языки. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這是克林崗帝國的一個星球，當地語言與克林貢並存。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Este é um planeta no Império Klingon, no qual línguas nativas sobreviveram ao lado de Klingon. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
This word appears only in the body of {KGT:src}, and in English, but the original Klingon name is obvious.

table.name: mem
table.column: be aggressive, be effective, be vigorous
vara aggressiv, vara effektiv, vara energisk, vara kraftfull
быть агрессивным, быть эффективным, быть бодрым
要有進取心、要有效、要有活力 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
ser agressivo, ser eficaz, ser vigoroso
This word was originally used in describing weapons, but is now also applied to people. It has strongly positive connotations in slang.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is the seat of the Klingon government.
Dies ist der Sitz der klingonischen Regierung. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這是克林崗政府的所在地。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Esta é a sede do governo Klingon. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

▶ {juHqo'Daq vaS'a' tu'lu'. ngoch luchermeH 'ej wo' San luwuqmeH pa' ghom tlhIngan yejquv DevwI'pu'. DaH che' ghawran. yejquv DevwI' moj ghawran 'e' wuqta' cho' 'oDwI' Dapu'bogh janluq pIqarD HoD.:sen:nolink} "On the Homeworld, there is a great hall where the leaders of the Klingon High Council meet to determine policy and decide upon the fate of the Empire. Gowron currently presides, named leader of the High Council by Captain Jean-Luc Picard, who was acting as Arbiter of Succession."[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to side-to-side distance, and does not have the metaphorical meanings such as "broad topic" or "wide range of opinions", nor is it used for the sense of "to the full extent" such as "eyes wide open".

Dies bezieht sich auf die Distanz von Seite zu Seite und hat weder die metaphorischen Bedeutungen wie "breites Thema" oder "breites Meinungsspektrum", noch wird es für den Sinn von "in vollem Umfang" wie "Augen weit" verwendet öffnen". [AUTOTRANSLATED]

این اشاره به فاصله یك طرف دارد و معانی استعاری از جمله "موضوع گسترده" یا "طیف گسترده ای از عقاید" ندارد ، و همچنین از آن برای احساس "تا حد كامل" مانند "چشم های گسترده" استفاده نمی شود. باز کن". [AUTOTRANSLATED]

Detta hänvisar till avstånd från sida till sida och har inte de metaforiska betydelserna som "brett ämne" eller "brett spektrum av åsikter", och det används inte heller för att "i full utsträckning" såsom "ögon breda" öppna". [AUTOTRANSLATED]

Это относится к расстоянию из стороны в сторону и не имеет метафорического значения, такого как «широкая тема» или «широкий диапазон мнений», и при этом оно не используется для определения «в полной мере», такого как «широко раскрытые глаза». открыто". [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這是指左右距離，不具有“廣泛話題”或“廣泛觀點”之類的隱喻含義，也沒有用於“全貌”之類的含義。打開”。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]

Isso se refere à distância de um lado para o outro e não possui significados metafóricos, como "tópico amplo" ou "ampla gama de opiniões", nem é usado para o sentido de "em toda a extensão", como "olhos arregalados" abrir". [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: To indicate "centuries ago" or "centuries from now", {ret:n} and {pIq:n} are used in place of {poH:n}, respectively.[3]
The sentence from {SkyBox 15:src} has the {wa'DIch:n} in the wrong place. Also, the second occurrence of {vatlh DIS poH:n} is missing a space.

table.name: mem
table.column: The siblings of a {vav:n:nolink} are {tennuS:n} and {'e'mam:n}.

The joke with {vav:n:nolink} and {SoS:n:nolink} is that in most human languages, the words for "father" and "mother" contain simple labial sounds (typically either "b" or "p" for father, and "m" for mother), whereas the fricatives {v:sen:nolink} and {S:sen:nolink} are difficult sounds for human infants to make.

table.name: mem
table.column:
Note that this can refer to an ambitious person, but not an ambitious task.
In contrast to {pIl:v}, this refers to self-motivation.
A determined person is one who "vow"s to do something.

table.name: mem
table.column: In ascending order of ferocity, the verbs used to describe military confrontations are: {Qor:v}, {tlhaS:v}, {vay:v:nolink}, {lul:v}, {Hargh:v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: کسی، چیزی، کسی، هر چیزی، کسی [AUTOTRANSLATED]
某人、某事、任何人、任何事物、某人 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
To express an indefinite subject, see {-lu':v:suff}.

table.name: mem
table.column: به یاد داشته باشید که عطر و بوی [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این به معنی "از تجربیات خود بیاموزید" [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta betyder "Lär dig av dina erfarenheter." [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這意味著“從您的經驗中學習”。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: vara nästa, vara efterföljande (i ordning, serie)
接下來（在一系列、序列中） [AUTOTRANSLATED]
ser o próximo (em uma série, sequência)
To refer to the next day, month, or year, consider using {leS:n}, {waQ:n}, and {nem:n}, respectively.
While {nungbogh:v:nolink} precedes a noun, {veb:v:nolink} comes after one.

table.name: mem
table.column: This means to span or cross in a stationary sense, as for example a bridge spanning a river, two fingers crossing, or a stripe painted across the road.

Dies bedeutet, stationär zu überspannen oder zu überqueren, wie zum Beispiel eine Brücke, die einen Fluss überspannt, zwei sich kreuzende Finger oder einen über die Straße gemalten Streifen. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این به معنای دهانه یا عبور به معنای ثابت است ، به عنوان مثال یک پل در حال عبور از یک رودخانه ، عبور از دو انگشت یا نوار نقاشی شده در طول جاده. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta innebär att spänna eller korsa i stationär mening, som till exempel en bro som sträcker sig över en flod, två fingrar som korsar eller en rand målad tvärs över vägen. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это означает, что он должен проходить или пересекать в стационарном смысле, например, мост через реку, пересечение двумя пальцами или полоса, нарисованная поперек дороги. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這意味著要以固定的方式跨度或交叉，例如跨河的橋樑，兩個手指交叉或在道路上塗有條紋。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Isso significa atravessar ou atravessar em sentido estacionário, como por exemplo uma ponte atravessando um rio, dois dedos cruzando ou uma faixa pintada na estrada. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: The plural of this word is {veDDIrmey:n:nolink} rather than {veDDIrDu':n:nolink}.[1; 2]

table.name: mem
table.column: go through (an open door, a tunnel, etc.)
بروید (درب باز، یک تونل و غیره) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
gå igenom (en öppen dörr, tunnel etc.)
пройти (открытая дверь, туннель и т. д.) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
passar (uma porta aberta, um túnel, etc.)

This verb only means to go through an opening of some sort, and not "to traverse" (in the sense of "going through" a forest).[1] The object is the thing being gone through. {-Daq:n:suff} is unnecessary.[2]
[1] {HQ 6.3, p.5-8, Sept. 1997:src}, [2] {HQ 7.4, Dec. 1998:src}, [3] {Klingon Monopoly:src}, [4] {paq'batlh:src}, [5] {KLI mailing list 2013.07.29:src}

table.name: mem
table.column: This translation was used in the subtitles to {Star Trek V:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: The text of {SkyBox 99:src} reads: ▶ {loS... qIb HeHDaq, 'u' SepmeyDaq Sovbe'lu'bogh lenglu'meH He ghoSlu'bogh retlhDaq 'oHtaH. HaDlu'meH, QuSlu'meH, SuDlu'meH lojmIt Da logh Hop Hut tengchaH. vaj loghDaq lenglaHtaH Humanpu'. veH Qav 'oH logh'e'.:sen:nolink}

table.name: mem
table.column:
The subject does the covering, while the object is covered.
This verb is used to describe the laying of a carpet. The person who lays a carpet is called a {velwI':n:nolink} (despite the fact that the grammar suggests that {velwI':n:nolink} would refer to the carpet itself).
▶ {rav vel tlhIm.:sen:nolink} "The carpet covers the floor." ▶ {rav velmeH tlhIm lo'.:sen:nolink} "He lays the carpet on the floor."

table.name: mem
table.column: In {Klingon Monopoly:src}, the "Chancellor's Cane Replica" is referred to as {Qang naQ velqa':n:nolink}.[1] Life-size models of dinosaurs such as one might see in a museum may also be referred to as {velqa':n:nolink}.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to elemental chromium, whereas {qo'rIn:n} refers to chromium salts like the ones used in leather tanning.
This appears to be a combination of {vel:v} and {So':v}. Chromium is often used to coat things.

table.name: mem
table.column: print, mark, tracks, trace, image, pattern
چاپ، علامت گذاری، آهنگ، ردیابی، تصویر، الگوی [AUTOTRANSLATED]
skriva ut, markera, spåra, spåra, bild, mönster [AUTOTRANSLATED]
печать, отметка, дорожки, след, изображение, рисунок [AUTOTRANSLATED]
打印、標記、軌道、跟踪、圖像、模式 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
imprimir, marca, faixas, rastreamento, imagem, padrão

This refers to the trace or marks left behind by touch, such as (the image of) a fingerprint, tire tracks, or the pattern in the dirt that results from stepping on it.
This word is contrasted with {Su'nIm:n} which refers to the pattern that makes the {vem:n:nolink}. But {Su'nIm:n:nolink} is used only when it's something very detailed which leaves the {vem:n:nolink}. For example, compare {nItlh Su'nIm:n} "fingerprint" (ridges on fingertip) with {nItlh Su'nIm vem:n} "fingerprint" (mark left behind after touching).
Note that an intentionally produced, stamp-like image is a {yang:n}.
In the following examples, the specific finger or toe name can be used instead of {nItlh:n} (or {yaD:n:1}).

▶ {nItlh Su'nIm vem:n@@nItlh:n, Su'nIm:n, vem:n} fingerprint (mark left behind after touching) ▶ {bem Su'nIm vem:n@@bem:n, Su'nIm:n, vem:n} footprint (specific pattern of bottom of shoe) ▶ {bem vem:n@@bem:n, vem:n} footprint (basic outline of a foot left in dirt) ▶ {namwech vem:n@@namwech:n, vem:n} paw print (pattern left in dirt)

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a bird that feeds almost exclusively on the serpent worm from which {qagh:n} is made. Klingons are not particularly fond of this bird.
An early bird catches the worm.

table.name: mem
table.column: This word describes someone who is really into something (or a number of things), who partakes in activities associated with it, and does so very seriously.
Dieses Wort beschreibt jemanden, der sich wirklich für etwas (oder eine Reihe von Dingen) interessiert, an Aktivitäten teilnimmt, die damit verbunden sind, und dies sehr ernst nimmt. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این کلمه شخصی را توصیف می کند که واقعاً به چیزی (یا تعدادی چیز) بپردازد ، که در فعالیت های مرتبط با آن شرکت می کند و این کار را بسیار جدی انجام می دهد. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta ord beskriver någon som verkligen är inne i något (eller ett antal saker), som deltar i aktiviteter som är associerade med det och gör det mycket på allvar. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это слово описывает кого-то, кто действительно во что-то (или несколько вещей), кто участвует в действиях, связанных с этим, и делает это очень серьезно. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這個詞描述的是一個真正從事某件事（或許多事情）的人，他參與與之相關的活動，並且做事非常認真。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Essa palavra descreve alguém que realmente gosta de algo (ou várias coisas), que participa de atividades associadas a ele e o faz muito a sério. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
"Fan", or possibly a reference to a Venn diagram where "nerd" is at the intersection of "intelligence", "obsession", and "social ineptitude".

table.name: mem
table.column:
This word describes someone who is really into something (or a number of things), who partakes in activities associated with it, and does so very seriously.
A more common term for this is {qatru':n:nolink}.

table.name: mem
mem
table.column: 第一城（克洛诺斯的首都）
This word appears only in the body of {KGT:src} and not in the glossary.

table.name: mem
table.column: This word appears only in the body of {KGT:src} and not in the glossary.

table.name: mem
table.column: proclamation, notification, announcement, and the like
اعلان، اطلاع رسانی، اعلام، و مانند آن [AUTOTRANSLATED]
proclamation, notification, announcement, and the like [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: There is an idiom, {qej; veqlargh rur@@qej:v, veqlargh:n, rur:v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: You pay attention to your Fek'lhr and I will pay attention to mine.
Du passt auf deinen Fek'lhr auf und ich achte auf meinen.
شما به Fek'lhr خود توجه می کنید و من به معدن توجه خواهم کرد. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Du uppmärksammar din Fek'lhr och jag kommer att uppmärksamma mina. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Вы обращаете внимание на свой Fek'lhr, а я обращаю внимание на мой. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
你注意你的Fek'lhr，我會關注我的。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Você presta atenção ao seu Fek'lhr e eu prestarei atenção ao meu.

table.name: mem
table.column: Siehe wie Gowron dies sagt: {YouTube video:url:http://youtu.be/PBM4fiXLc-U}

table.name: mem
table.column: Your ship is a garbage scow.
Seu navio é uma embarcação de lixo.

table.name: mem
table.column: This word can be used to talk about the wind ({SuS:n}). For example, {ver SuS'a':sen@@ver:v:1, SuS:n, -'a':n} means "a tornado happens". {ver SuS:sen@@ver:v:1, SuS:n} or {ver SuSHom:sen@@ver:v:1, SuS:n, -Hom:n} would most likely refer to a whirlwind.

Mit diesem Wort kann man den Wind ({SuS:n}) beschreiben. Zum Beispiel {ver SuS'a':sen@@ver:v:1, SuS:n, -'a':n} bedeutet "es findet ein Tornado statt". {ver SuS:sen@@ver:v:1, SuS:n} oder {ver SuSHom:sen@@ver:v:1, SuS:n, -Hom:n} würde wahrscheinlich einen Wirbelwind beschreiben.

table.name: mem
table.column: Ferengis are known for their greed, as reflected in the comparison {qur; verengan rur@@qur:v, verengan:n, rur:v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is the name of the Ferengi Homeworld, the primary planet in the Ferengi Alliance.
Dies ist der Name der Ferengi-Heimatwelt, dem Hauptplaneten der Ferengi-Allianz. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این نام Ferengi Homeworld ، سیاره اولیه در اتحاد فرنگی است. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta är namnet på Ferengi Homeworld, den främsta planeten i Ferengi Alliance. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это название Дома Ференги, основной планеты в Альянсе Ференги. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這就是Ferengi聯盟的主要星球Ferengi Homeworld的名稱。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Este é o nome do Ferengi Homeworld, o planeta principal da Aliança Ferengi. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: Siehe wie Gowron dies sagt: {YouTube video:url:http://youtu.be/8MLXFbHYZOk}

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to a place with a structure to attach a vessel to, like a pier.[2]
This was defined only as "dock" in {TKD:src}. The definition was expanded at {qep'a' 25 (2018):src}.

table.name: mem
table.column:
The object is the vehicle that is docked.[3]
In {Klingon Monopoly:src}, "Free Parking" is translated as {vergh 'ach DIlnISbe':sen:nolink}.
▶ {nuqDaq puH Duj vIvergh?:sen:nolink} "Where can I park the car?"[3]

table.name: mem
table.column: Contrast this with {noH:n}, which refers to a specific war.[1, p.47]

table.name: mem
table.column: From lowest to highest, these ranks are: {tay:n:3}, {Sutay:n}, {veStay:n:nolink}, {Santay:n}, {'Iptay:n}.
This is a rank from John M. Ford's 1984 novel "The Final Reflection". These ranks are used by many Klingon fan clubs, despite not appearing in canon (i.e., in any TV episode or movie).

table.name: mem
table.column: Marc Okrand decided to put this word into {TKD:src} because he thought that if any animal survives into the future, it would surely be the cockroach.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: insert, put in, pin (attach or fasten with a pin)
قرار دادن، قرار دادن، پین (با یک پین وصل یا وصل کنید) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
sätt in, sätt in, stift (fäst eller fäst med en stift) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
вставьте, вставьте штифт (прикрепите или закрепите штифтом) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
插入、放入、銷（用別針固定或固定） [AUTOTRANSLATED]
inserir, colocar, prender (prender ou amarrar com um prendedor)

This was defined as "insert, put in" in 2015.[1] It was expanded to include "pin, attach or fasten with a pin" in 2016.[2] It was also mentioned that this is possible to use with {watrIn:n:nolink} in 2020.[3]

table.name: mem
table.column: In the "Limited Edition" example, since {veymey:n:nolink} is plural, the correct grammar should have {luchenmoHlu'pu':v:nolink}.

▶ {veymey puS neH chenmoHlu'pu':sen:nolink} "Limited Edition" ▶ {boSwI'vaD veyvam le' chenmoHlu':sen:nolink} "Collector's Edition" ▶ {wa' tlhIngan QaS vey:n:nolink} "one pack of Klingon forces" ▶ {'echletHom vey:n}

table.name: mem
table.column: This is similar to {yap:v}, but {vey':v:nolink} implies being more than enough/sufficient.
Dies ist ähnlich wie {yap:v}, aber {vey':v:nolink} bedeutet mehr als nur genug.

table.name: mem
table.column: This means more than not being enough or being insufficient (see {yap:v}).
Dies ist noch weniger als zu wenig oder unzureichend (siehe {yap:v}).

table.name: mem
table.column: travel with a purpose, for a specific reason; travel on a mission
mit einer Absicht bzw. Mission reisen
برای اهداف خاص سفر کنید سفر به یک ماموریت [AUTOTRANSLATED]
resa med ett syfte, av en särskild anledning resa på ett uppdrag [AUTOTRANSLATED]
путешествовать с целью, по определенной причине; путешествовать на миссии [AUTOTRANSLATED]
出於特定原因有目的地旅行;旅行團 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
viajar com um propósito, por um motivo específico; viajar em missã]
The example sentence is a lip-match for {DevwI' ghaH 'Iv'e'?@@DevwI':n, ghaH:n, 'Iv:ques:1h, -'e':n:suff}.
▶ {jIvuylaH. jIve'.:sen@@jI-:v, vuy:v, -laH:v, jI-:v, ve':v} "I am here to help you."[2]

table.name: mem
table.column:
{jIH:n:1h}:{ghaH:n}/{'oH:n}/{chaH:n}/{bIH:n} = {vI-:v:pref,nolink}
When used with {-lu':v}, this prefix means "Someone (indefinite subject) does something to me".

table.name: mem
table.column: move through time toward the future
durch die Zeit in die Zukunft reisen
از زمان به سمت آینده حرکت کردن [AUTOTRANSLATED]
move through time toward the future [AUTOTRANSLATED]
avançar no tempo em direção ao futuro
▶ {wa'vatlh DIS vIvIb:sen:nolink} "I time-travel 100 years into the future." ▶ {jIvIb. qaSDI' vatlh DIS poH cha'maH Hut, jImev.:sen:nolink} "I time-travel to the 29th century."

table.name: mem
table.column: This was defined parenthetically in the definition of {vIb:v:1,nolink}. The note that this is not used in reference to plants implies that this means "to be transmitted, as through a medium", and not "to breed".

table.name: mem
table.column: move through time toward the past
durch die Zeit in die Vergangenheit reisen
از زمان به سمت گذشته حرکت کردن [AUTOTRANSLATED]
flytta genom tiden mot det förflutna [AUTOTRANSLATED]
avançar através do tempo em direção ao passado
▶ {jIvIbHa'pu' 'ej qeylIS vIqIHpu'.:sen:nolink} "I time-traveled into the past and I met Kahless." ▶ {jIvIbHa'. wejHu' jImev.:sen:nolink} "I time-travel three days into the past."

table.name: mem
table.column: vara stridslysten, vara stridande, vara krigförande

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a device that regulates the flow of gas, sound, etc.
Dies ist ein Gerät, das den Fluss von Gas, Schall usw. reguliert. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این وسیله ای است که جریان گاز ، صدا و غیره را تنظیم می کند. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta är en enhet som reglerar flödet av gas, ljud etc. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это устройство, которое регулирует поток газа, звука и т. Д. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這是調節氣體，聲音等流量的設備。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Este é um dispositivo que regula o fluxo de gás, som etc. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: type of animal, v'gro (like a cat)
tipo de animal, v'gro (como um gato)
"Figaro" is the name of the cat in Disney's Pinocchio. This word isn't named directly for that, but via an actual cat named "Figaro".

table.name: mem
table.column:
This verb is intransitive. To say that someone or something moves someone or something else, use {vIHmoH:v:nolink}.[2]
For an idiomatic expression used to tell someone not to move, see {taD:v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This idiomatic expression means that an activity of finite (though perhaps indeterminate) length has started. It originates from {qa'vaQ:n}.
▶ {bISop DaneH'a'? vIHtaH gho.:sen:nolink} "If you want to eat, say so now before the food is gone."

table.name: mem
table.column: See {Hut'In vIl:n} for the pun behind {vIl:v:nolink}.

table.name: mem
table.column: someone or something who is just there; someone who is around when you are
jemand oder etwas das immer da ist
کسی یا چیزی که فقط وجود دارد کسی که در اطراف شما هست [AUTOTRANSLATED]
кто-то или что-то, кто только там; кто-то, кто рядом, когда ты [AUTOTRANSLATED]
某人或某物就在那裡;你身邊的人 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
alguém ou algo que está lá; alguém que está por perto quando você está
When this word was defined at {qep'a' 16 (2009):src}, a description of an object which was recognised as a "speed bump" was given as an example of a {vIl:n:nolink}.

table.name: mem
table.column: 追隨者、門徒、粉絲、崇拜者、奴才 [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: The suggestion was made at {qep'a' 16 (2009):src} that a {vIlHom:n:nolink} could be a single ridge in a {Quch:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: en slags fågel (förmögen att härma språk)
This is a bird capable of mimicking speech. Some people pluralize this word with {-pu':n:suff}, but most use {-mey:n:suff}.
This is a reference to Captain Flint, Long John Silver's parrot in "Treasure Island".

table.name: mem
table.column: {lor:n:0} eller {tey':n:0}; kusin, brorsdotter, systerdotter, brorson, systerson

In the singular, typically {tey':n:nolink} or {lor:n:nolink} is preferred unless the individual is being referred to as a member of a group that likely includes both {tey':n:nolink} and/or {lor:n:nolink}. The plural form {vInpu':n:nolink} is used for a group that includes {tey':n:nolink} and/or {lor:n:nolink}.
A reference to the movie "My Cousin Vinny".

table.name: mem
table.column: compatriot, community member, cohort, fellow citizen
Landsmann, Mitbürger, Mitglied der Mannschaft oder der Truppe
هموطن، عضو جامعه، همکار، شهروند دیگر [AUTOTRANSLATED]
compatriot, community member, cohort, fellow citizen [AUTOTRANSLATED]
同胞、社區成員、同夥、同胞 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
compatriota, membro da comunidade, coorte, concidadão
The example sentence is a lip-match for {'ej DochmeywIj vItlhapqa'meH}.
▶ {'ej Dojmey wID, vInDa'ma' peq.:sen@@'ej:conj, Dojmey:n, wID:v, vInDa':n, -ma':n, peq:v} "He has killed many of our people."[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This word refers to the abstract concept of combat. A specific battle is a {may':n}.
The TV show "Combat!" starred Vic Morrow.

table.name: mem
table.column: This term is more general than a visual piece of art. It covers that, but also an artifact (not in the archeological sense), handicraft, gizmo, gadget, contraption, machine, device, etc. That is, it refers to something manufactured or made.

Dieser Begriff ist allgemeiner als ein visuelles Kunstwerk. Es umfasst das, aber auch ein Artefakt (nicht im archäologischen Sinne), Kunsthandwerk, Gizmo, Gadget, Apparat, Maschine, Gerät usw. Das heißt, es bezieht sich auf etwas Hergestelltes oder Hergestelltes. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

این اصطلاح عمومی تر از یک اثر هنری بصری است. آن را در بر می گیرد ، بلکه یک مصنوعی (نه به معنای باستان شناسی) ، صنایع دستی ، گیزمو ، اسباب بازی ، لوازم جانبی ، دستگاه ، وسیله و غیره را شامل می شود. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

Denna term är mer generell än ett visuellt konstverk. Det täcker det, men också en artefakt (inte i arkeologisk bemärkelse), hantverk, gizmo, pryl, kontrast, maskin, anordning etc. Det vill säga att det hänvisar till något som tillverkas eller tillverkas. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

Этот термин является более общим, чем визуальное произведение искусства. Он охватывает это, но также и артефакт (не в археологическом смысле), ремесло, штуковину, гаджет, устройство, машину, устройство и т. Д. То есть относится к чему-то произведенному или изготовленному. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
該術語比視覺藝術品更為籠統。它涵蓋了這些內容，還涵蓋了人工製品（不是考古意義上的），手工藝品，小發明，小工具，設備，機器，設備等。也就是說，它是指已製造或製造的東西。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]

Este termo é mais geral do que uma obra de arte visual. Ele abrange isso, mas também um artefato (não no sentido arqueológico), artesanato, aparelhos, engenhocas, engenhocas, máquinas, dispositivos, etc. Ou seja, refere-se a algo fabricado ou fabricado. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: This means to be deprived of air. For "drown", precede the verb with {bIQDaq:sen@@bIQ:n, -Daq:n} or the like.
This was confirmed not to take an object.

table.name: mem
table.column: This means to cause someone/something to be deprived of air. For "drown", precede the verb with {bIQDaq:sen@@bIQ:n, -Daq:n} or the like.

table.name: mem
table.column: پاره شدن (تا) ، بریدن ، پارگی (تا) ، گش کردن [AUTOTRANSLATED]
撕裂（向上），斜線，撕裂（向上），煤氣 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
For example, this would be used for ripping a photo in half.
Dies würde beispielsweise verwendet, um ein Foto in zwei Hälften zu zerreißen. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
به عنوان مثال ، این می تواند برای پاره کردن یک عکس به صورت نصف استفاده شود. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Till exempel skulle detta användas för att rippa ett foto i hälften. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Например, это будет использовано для копирования фотографии пополам. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
例如，這將用於將照片撕成兩半。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Por exemplo, isso seria usado para rasgar uma foto ao meio. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: تمام سلاح ها برای کنترل من! [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Todas as armas sob meu controle!

table.name: mem
table.column: teste da verdade, duelo da verdade
It's not specified whether this is a noun or a verb, but it's likely to be a noun, even though {Hay':n:nolink,hyp} is not known to exist as a noun.

table.name: mem
table.column: be high, great (in quantity, size, intensity)
hoch, viel sein (in Menge, Abmessung, Intensität)
بالا بودن، عالی (در مقدار، اندازه، شدت) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
vara hög, stor (i kvantitet, storlek, intensitet) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
быть высоким, отличным (по количеству, размеру, интенсивности) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
很高、很棒（數量、大小、強度） [AUTOTRANSLATED]
ser alto, grande (em quantidade, tamanho, intensidade)

This is used for things that are measurable or quantifiable, but not necessarily countable. For countable things, {law':v} would normally be used, but {vItlh:v:nolink} would be used if the number is higher than normal or greater than before or greater than what was expected.[3]
▶ {DoDaj vItlh law' wab Do vItlh puS.:sen:nolink} "faster than the speed of sound"[1] ▶ {Do vItlh:n:nolink} "high velocity"[3] ▶ {chuq vItlh:n:nolink} "great range, great distance"[3]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is any liquid from a plant. In some regional dialects, this word is used for any liquid accompanying food.
Dies ist jede Flüssigkeit aus einer Pflanze. In einigen regionalen Dialekten wird dieses Wort für alle flüssigen Lebensmittel verwendet. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این مایع از گیاه است. در بعضی از گویش های منطقه ای ، این کلمه برای هر ماده غذایی همراهی مایع استفاده می شود. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta är vilken vätska som helst från en växt. I vissa regionala dialekter används detta ord för alla vätskor som följer mat. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это любая жидкость из растения. На некоторых региональных диалектах это слово используется для обозначения любых жидких сопутствующих продуктов. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這是來自工廠的任何液體。在某些地區性方言中，該詞用於任何伴隨食物的液體。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Este é qualquer líquido de uma planta. Em alguns dialetos regionais, essa palavra é usada para qualquer alimento líquido que o acompanhe. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
"V8" is a juice blend made from tomato juice mixed with the juices of various vegetables.

table.name: mem
table.column: Earwax (see {Serrum:n}) is said to do this in the ear.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: ▶ {cha' vI' vagh choQmey lutoghlu':sen:nolink} "Number of Decks: 2.5" {BoP:src}

table.name: mem
table.column: The Tide brand of laundry detergent is also sold under the mark Vizir. (Note that {vI'Ir:n:nolink} written in "xifan hol" is "vizir".)

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a reference to Phileas Fogg, the protagonist of the Jules Verne novel "Around the World in Eighty Days".

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a shortened version of {voDmeH jan:n} which is often heard.

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to the entire device, not just the drill bit. This is often shortened to {voD jan:n}.
This is defined as "drill". The word "device" was added to disambiguate this from (and to be consistent in appearance with) {qeq:n} "drill (military)".

table.name: mem
table.column:
This is a spider-like creature with nine legs, but sometimes seven or eight (and not fewer than seven unless it is injured).
A large spider on Earth would be a {tera' voDchuch:n@@tera':n, voDchuch:n}, but a small spider would not be a {voDchuch:n:nolink}.
{voD:v} "bore" + {chuch:n} "ice" = Boris. "Boris the Spider" is a song by The Who.

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to meat prepared by {HaH:v:2}. The word for the specific meat replaces the word {Ha'DIbaH:n:1}.

table.name: mem
table.column: When used as a locative, this word is not followed by the locative suffix {-Daq:n:suff}.[3]
▶ {vogh vISuch vIneH.:sen:nolink} "I want to visit some place."[2] ▶ {vogh tIghla' tu'lu':sen:nolink} "there's a t'gla somewhere"[3]

table.name: mem
table.column: This word can be the object of {wel:v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This word is used in {Klingon Monopoly:src} to denote how many {QaS:n:1h} the player receives for mortgaging a planet to the bank.

table.name: mem
table.column: 窗格、面板、床單（不適用於床） [AUTOTRANSLATED]
This is a term related to artwork.
Dies ist ein Begriff, der sich auf Kunstwerke bezieht. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این اصطلاح مربوط به آثار هنری است. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta är en term relaterad till konstverk. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это термин, связанный с произведениями искусства. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這是一個與藝術品有關的術語。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Este é um termo relacionado a obras de arte. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: snara, snärja, fånga (i fälla), förleda, lura
This is a reference to Captain "von Trapp" from The Sound of Music, who was played by Christopher Plummer, who of course was also General Chang ({cheng:n:name}).

table.name: mem
table.column: This slang term is not used in reference to games, but is applied only to more serious matters.[1, p.165]
Note that in the example, the prefix {bI-:v} is used rather than {Da-:v}. This might indicate that the apparent {-lu':v} suffix is a fossilized form and isn't truly the suffix.

table.name: mem
table.column: lita på, tro på, ha tillit till

table.name: mem
table.column: Voq was an outcast who referred to himself as "son of none" ({pagh puqloD:n@@pagh:n:1, puqloD:n}). He is a follower of {tIquvma:n:name}, and was given the role of {Sech qengwI':n} after the death of {rej'aq:n:name}. He is an albino, whose skin colour was described as {Dem:v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: kväva, kvävas, strypa, strypas, få något i halsen
Based on the similarity to {vIQ:v:nolink}, this appears not to take an object.

table.name: mem
table.column: This word appears to consist of the verb {voQ:v} (or a homophonous but unknown noun) and {SIp:n}, so it means something like "choking gas".

table.name: mem
table.column: ▶ {Hoch vor Dargh wIb.:sen:nolink} "Sour tea cures everything."[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: It is unclear why Federation Standard corrupted the spelling of this word by moving the {qaghwI':n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This word appears only in the body of {KGT:src} and not in the glossary.

table.name: mem
table.column: ▶ {QIStaq qul bIQtIqHomDaq 'etlhDaj vo' nuch:sen:nolink} "The coward throws his sword into the fire streams of Kri'stak"[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is the name of a Federation starship.
Dies ist der Name eines Raumschiffs der Föderation. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این نام یک ستاره دریایی فدراسیون است. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta är namnet på ett Federation-rymdskepp. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Este é o nome de uma nave estelar da Federação. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: Cowards take hostages. Klingons do not.
بزدل گروگان ها را می گیرند کلینگان ها نمی کنند [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Cowards tar gisslan. Klingons gör det inte. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
懦夫劫持人質。克林崗人沒有。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
mem
table.column: This verb can be used with {turmIq:n}, {qeQ:n}, and {taQbang:n:2}.

table.name: mem
table.column:
Vulcans are also sometimes called Vulcanians in English.[2]
Note that this is {vulqangan:n:nolink} and not {vulqanngan:n:nolink} (the {n:sen:nolink} at the end of {vulqan:n:nolink} is dropped).
There is a Klingon idiom, {nong; vulqangan rur@@nong:v, vulqangan:n, rur:v}, which is meant ironically.
This transliteration is used in the subtitles of {Star Trek V:src} among other places.

table.name: mem
table.column: contemptible or despicable person, scumbag, bastard
verächtliche oder verabscheuungswürdige Person, Drecksack, Bastard
فرد نابهنگام یا نفرت انگیز، scumbag، bastard [AUTOTRANSLATED]
föraktig eller avskyvärd person, scumbag, bastard [AUTOTRANSLATED]
презренный или презренный человек, подонок, ублюдок [AUTOTRANSLATED]
卑鄙或卑鄙的人、卑鄙小人、私生子 [AUTOTRANSLATED]

The first part of the example sentence was a lip-match for {mughojmoH parmaqqaywI':sen@@mu-:v, ghojmoH:v, parmaqqay:n, -wI':n}. The second part was a lip-match for {'ej jIHvo' nIHDI' jIbup:sen@@'ej:conj, jIH:n:1h, -vo':n, nIH:v, -DI':v, jI-:v, bup:v}.

▶ {potlhmo' batlh, vIqawba', 'ej chIvo' neH chIw vum'e'.@@potlh:v, -mo':v, batlh:n, vI-:v, qaw:v, -ba':v, 'ej:conj, chIvo':n, neH:adv, chIw:v, vum:n, -'e':n} "Because you care about honor. And this man has none."[2]

سفارش (در یک رستوران، از کاتالوگ، و غیره) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
beställning (i en restaurang, från en katalog, etc.) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
заказ (в ресторане, по каталогу и т. д.) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
pedido (em um restaurante, de um catálogo etc.)

table.name: mem
table.column: um ciclone ou furacão se inciam
Note that this is a verb in Klingon. In Klingon, one says "it hurricanes", similar to how one says "it rains" in English.
Beachten Sie, dass dies ein Verb auf Klingonisch ist. Auf Klingonisch sagt man "es gibt Hurrikane", ähnlich wie man auf Englisch "es regnet" sagt. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
توجه داشته باشید که این یک فعل در کلینگون است. در كلنگون ، كسی می گوید "طوفان است" ، شبیه به اینكه یك كلمه انگلیسی می گوید "باران می بارد". [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Observera att detta är ett verb i Klingon. I Klingon säger man "det orkaner", liknande det man säger "det regnar" på engelska. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Обратите внимание, что это глагол в клингоне. В клингоне говорят «это ураганы», подобно тому, как говорят «по-английски идет дождь». [AUTOTRANSLATED]
請注意，這是克林崗語中的動詞。在克林貢，有人說“颶風”，類似於用英語說“下雨”。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Note que este é um verbo em Klingon. Em Klingon, diz-se "faz furacões", semelhante a como diz-se "chove" em inglês. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

mem

table.name: mem
table.column: cook, prepare food, make a beverage
طبخ، آماده کردن غذا، یک نوشیدنی [AUTOTRANSLATED]
做飯、準備食物、做一個飲料 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
cozinhar, preparar alimentos, fazer uma bebida
The definition in {TKD:src} is just "cook". On {KGT p.83:src}, this is expanded to include the preparation of any food, including beverages. Reverse of {tuv:v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to a place where food is prepared.
Dies bezieht sich auf einen Ort, an dem Essen zubereitet wird. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این مربوط به مکانی است که غذا تهیه می شود. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta avser en plats där mat tillagas. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это относится к месту, где готовится еда. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這是指準備食物的地方。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Refere-se a um local onde a comida é preparada. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
